text.title: Wikinews interviews Australian sit skier Lincoln Budge

head.s: Wikinews interviews Australian sit skier Lincoln Budge

caption.s: interviews Australian Paralympic skier Lincoln Budge

p.s:
Recently ,
Wikinews
spent time with with
Australian
Paralympic
skier
Lincoln Budge who was in
Copper Mountain
,
Colorado
for this week 's
IPC
Nor-Am Cup .
Nor-Am Cup and you 're not skiing today ?
Well I skied first run .
Ooh , a DNF [ Did not finish ] .
DNF , so nothing else for the rest of the afternoon now .
So how have you preformed in the past days ?
I 've done pretty well in the previous days .
I 've finished every race till now which has been good , I 've improved my points on what I 've had previously , so I 'm progressing slowly and , yeah , it 's good .

What
classification
are you ?

Are you shooting for
Sochi
or are you just kind of developing now with the idea of the next one [ Winter Paralympics ] in 2018 ?
I 'd like to go to Sochi , but realistically it 's probably not going to happen , I 've only been skiing for three years , so .
Yeah .
And you 're from some town that 's really hard to pronounce in Australia .

Yes ,
Yackandandah
.
What state is this in ?
, north east Victoria
So Victoria is the state that produces all the great Australian skiers ?
Correct , Victoria is the state to be in .
How long have you been in the development team ?
Been skiing for almost three years now .
On the development team or just period ?
Period but I pretty much got onto the development team [ ... ] days in[ ? ] , so all my skiing has been with the team .

You never considered doing the
nordic skiing
?
No way .
That 's way too much dedication .

Where do you like to ski and which , like
Super G
,
Slalom
, is your favourite ?
would be the one I 've enjoyed most so far .
It 's fast , obviously , a speed event , and the whole build-up to it , ' s really fun and I enjoy the speed events .
Where do you like to ski ?

Are you one of these people likes to come to the
US
, or do you think Victoria 's got the best ski fields in the world ?
US is pretty good , I 've sort of skied quite a few hills .
I 've based somewhere different each year so far . [ ... ]

I do n't
really
have a preferred one .
Considering how expensive skiing is , do you think you 're getting adequate support from everyone to enable you to continue your ski career ?
Yeah , at the moment I 'm getting good support from the team and everyone , which is really good and hopefully financially I can keep doing it into the future .

As someone watching skiing : can you throw your
monoski
over your shoulder and transport it that way ?
I can if I want to but I 've got a set of wheels that I clip the rig into so I can push it around more easily than putting it on me shoulder .
I cart skis[ ? ] around on my shoulder , but I 've got a set of wheels , just to make it easier .
Ok , thank you very very much .
